person.persName: Samuel Beal Thomas (Hardin County, Kentucky, U.S. mail contractor and businessman)

body.p: Hardin County, Kentucky, U.S. mail contractor and businessman. Frederick County, Maryland, native. Son of Samuel Thomas. Married to Zorayda Young on September 19, 1833. Father of Howard Thomas, Wallace Thomas, Mary E. Thomas, Ellen M. Thomas, and Ann Thomas. Relocated to West Point, Hardin County, Kentucky, in 1828. Mail clerk in the office of Edward P. Johnson. Road agent in the office of Edward P. Johnson. Purchased Johnson's mail line in 1830. Part-owner of Hough, Carter, & Thomas Stage Coach Line in Kentucky, Tennessee, and Alabama. Founding director and financier of the Louisville and Nashville Railroad. Owned thirty-nine enslaved persons in 1850 and fifty-six in 1860. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky for Hardin County from 1863 to 1865.
